forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers. Cloudy, with a low around 55. South wind 16 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers before 4pm, then rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South wind 18 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the gentle embrace of the night, Downtown San Francisco finds itself cloaked in the hushed whispers of rain showers. The city, tucked away under a blanket of clouds, stirs beneath the silver glimmers of streetlights reflecting on damp pavement. As the gusts from the south sweep through, their brisk touch carries a promise of more rain to come. The air feels alive with moisture, and the soft patter of droplets creates a rhythm, a delicate lullaby that both soothes and warns. 

As dawn approaches, the forecast unveils a day accentuated by persistent rain extending into the afternoon, with temperatures unhurriedly settling into the briskness of fifty-nine degrees. The clouds linger, and although the city may begin to seep into the crisp light, the marine layer stands guard at the gates of the Golden Gate, shrouding the bridge in a spectral embrace. Such weather invites one to consider inner warmth; a cozy sweater hugged close, perhaps paired with a waterproof jacket. This dreary day resonates with the charm of indoor activities—perhaps a leisurely stroll through the art-filled corridors of a local museum or settling into a favorite café, coffee in hand, while watching the world glisten through rain-streaked windows. Even amidst the damp air and swirling clouds, there lies an authenticity in the city's spirit; a hidden beauty that constantly unfurls beneath the layers of fog and mist, beckoning quiet adventure on this rainy Sunday.
